description: From Middle English hosen, from Old English hosan (“hosen, leggings, trousers”), plural of hosa (“hose, legging, stocking”); reinforced by German Hosen (“trousers, pants”).

entries.meaning: (poetic, historical, archaic) plural of hose (the old-fashioned garment; stockings)
examples: These men were bound in their coats, their hosen, and their hats, and their other garments.

entries.meaning: Coverings for the legs; trousers; pants.
examples: At the court of the Kaiser I born was and bred ; and there my hosen and jerkin were made ; […]
